item.description: Epitaph If I could swap your life for mine (If they were ours to trade) I wonder what you may have done, And who you might have made. Perhaps you might have found a way To ever change the Earth– Perhaps you might have had your say, And shown the world your worth. Perhaps your name would travel far - You’d hold the world enthralled The magnitude of who you are

You don’t need a broomstick to fly - To pass the Quaffle across the sky, To wrestle with grief whilst walking the woods, To explore what happens when we shouldn’t (but could). You don’t need a rocket to reach the stars Nor nary a cent to travel afar - To brave, with Peter and Susan, the snow, To help deal Durza the final blow. You don’t need a dollar, a pence, or a yen
